meanings.definition: Feel or show great joy or delight.
meanings.sent1: I rejoice when I see my favorite flowers blooming in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The children rejoice when they hear the ice cream truck coming down the street.
meanings.sent3: As the puppy chased its tail, it seemed to rejoice in its own playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The whole town seemed to rejoice as the sun finally broke through the clouds after days of rain.
meanings.sent5: Her heart started to rejoice like a symphony orchestra playing a beautiful melody.

meanings.sent1: We rejoice in the simple pleasures of life, like a warm cup of tea on a cold day.
meanings.sent2: The fans rejoice every time their favorite team scores a goal.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to rejoice in knocking over the vase, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to rejoice in the gentle breeze, swaying gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's eyes would always rejoice at the sight of a rainbow after the rain.
